main.name: Jordan Hayes
main.description: I'm a Junior Computer Science student currently studying at Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology
main.bio: I love programming and being a software engineer because it allows me to combine the technical aspects that challenge me and the creativity that comes along with building a solution. I have interest and experience in Front End, Back End, and Mobile Development.
main.contactmessage: Currently open for freelance projects and opportunities as well as full time positions.

resume.skillmessage: One of the best things about engineering and design is that you are constantly learning and I love learning, especially new technologies.

education.description: Rose-Hulman is a small, but mighty, undergraduate school that focuses on the individual. There I was able to work closely with my professors to truly learn the fundamentals and then take the next steps by working on my own side projects.

work.title: Software Engineering Intern
work.description: Gathered requirements and provided a mocks for approval. Served as Scrum Master for my intern team where I scheduled sprint planning meetings, ran stand ups, and reached out to external resouces to give our team coffee chats and lunch and learns. I also lead the frontend team in developing a React portal to label metadata of Hive tbales utilized in other Machine Learning tools throughout the company. This labelling enables better searching, categorizations, and tagging of both the metadata and the ML models that utilize them.

work.company: Rose-Hulman Computer Science and Software Engineering Department
work.title: Teachers Assistant/Grader
work.description: Held weekly office hours to facilitate learning of fundamental database concepts like 3NF and basic and more advanced SQL queries.

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: Assisted in developing on what is now the third iteration of the project I devlved into last time. I utilzed Salesforce MuleSoft with the goal of creating a no-code/low-code integrations solution for non-technical coworkers to more easily and quickly integrate new for clients to reduce total time taken and overall engineering manpower needed. During the course of the summer I completed work on: a new internal service for creating generic dashboards, a new client integration, and several migrations.

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: Worked with a small team of developers where I established a more streamlined development system. I also created more extensive documentation for each feature I worked on included UI Sketches, DB Schemas, and a Feature Write Up. I also created a basic landing page with the framework to be an SEO. Technologies utilized were Typescript, React, Vue, Express.JS, Jest testing framework, and Node.JS.

work.title: Full Stack Engineer
work.description: Helped this early stage startup work towards an MVP to present to investors for funding. My main work included setting Apolllo and GraphQL mutations and queries, creating several customer and admin pages using React and Redux and doing light documentation work, such DB Schemas.

work.title: Software Engineering Intern
work.description: Worked in small team to help build the first iteration of scaling down the time it takes to integrate a new client. My work consisted of helping design the strategy and system design for this endevavour, standing up a new microservice with the generacized models and REST API endpoints in Java, and some front end work in React on both the citizen and government management side. Other technologies utilized inclide Mocha testing framework, MongoDB, and Kafka.
